p: The aporphine alkaloids lysicamine ( 1), trivalvone ( 2) (Fig. 1) were identified from the leaves of Annickia kummeriae (Annonaceae) from Tanzania, along with four other (protoberberine) alkaloids. Plants from the genus Annickia (formerly Enantia) are popularly known in West and Central Africa for use in the treatment of malaria [ 70– 72]. The study by Maleba et al. [ 58] showed that compounds 1 and 2 showed respective activities of 8.23 and 2.90 μM against the CQ-resistant K1 strain of P. falciparum.
